Data.event_text: 11 January  Ukraine announces the capture of two North Korean soldiers during fighting in Russia's Kursk Oblast.

links.text: -"Ukraine says it captured two North Korean soldiers in Russia's Kursk". Al Jazeera. Retrieved 12 January 2025.-

Data.event_text: 17 January  Iran and Russia sign a "comprehensive strategic partnership treaty".

links.text: -"Russia and Iran presidents sign partnership treaty in Moscow". Al Jazeera. 18 January 2025. Retrieved 18 January 2025.-

Data.event_text: 23 January  The Russian spy vessel Kidin is reported to have caught fire off the coast of Syria.

links.text: -"A Russian spy ship caught fire off Syria's coast, officials say. Here's audio of its broadcasts". AP News. 7 February 2025. Retrieved 7 February 2025.-

Data.event_text: 29 January  An illegal logger opens fire at forest rangers trying to arrest him in Usokhi, Kaluga Oblast, killing three rangers and holding two others hostage before committing suicide.

links.text: -"Illegal Logger Kills 3 Forest Rangers in Kaluga Region Before Taking His Own Life". The Moscow Times. 29 January 2025. Retrieved 29 January 2025.-

Data.event_text: 6 February  Yury Borisov is dismissed as director-general of Roscosmos by President Putin and is replaced by Gonets head Dmitry Bakanov.

links.text: -"Putin Sacks Roscosmos Chief Yury Borisov Amid Setbacks at Space Agency". The Moscow Times. 6 February 2025. Retrieved 6 February 2025.-

Data.event_text: An underwater cable in the Baltic Sea owned by Rostelecom is damaged following an "external impact".

links.text: -"Russia Says Baltic Sea Cable Damaged by 'External Impact'". The Moscow Times. 8 February 2025. Retrieved 9 February 2025.-

Data.event_text: At least eight people are injured in a fire at the former Elektrozavod building in Moscow.

links.text: -"Dozens rescued as fire at former electrical plant in Moscow leaves eight others injured". AP News. 8 February 2025. Retrieved 9 February 2025.-

Data.event_text: 9 February  A state of emergency is declared in Sakhalin Oblast after the Chinese cargo vessel An Ying 2 runs aground off the coast of Nevelsky District.

links.text: -"Part of Russia's island of Sakhalin on high alert after Chinese cargo ship runs aground". AP News. 9 February 2025. Retrieved 9 February 2025.-

Data.event_text: The European Court of Human Rights rules that the Russian government had engaged in "a coordinated effort to suppress dissent" over its invasion of Ukraine.

links.text: -"ECHR Rules That Russia Suppressed Dissent Over Ukraine War". The Moscow Times. 11 February 2025. Retrieved 11 February 2025.-

Data.event_text: Marc Fogel, an American teacher detained in Russia for drugs charges since 2021, is released and repatriated to the United States as part of a prisoner exchange.

links.text: -"Who is Marc Fogel, the US teacher released by Russia?". Al Jazeera. Retrieved 12 February 2025.-

Data.event_text: 12 February  US President Donald Trump announces the beginning of negotiations with Russia to end the war in Ukraine following a phone call with President Putin.

links.text: -"Ukraine war talks start now, Trump says after Putin call". BBC. 13 February 2025. Retrieved 13 February 2025.-

Data.event_text: The FSB says that it had killed several members of a terrorist group plotting an attack on the Pskov train station following a shootout.

links.text: -"Pskov Train Station Attack Plotters Killed in Shootout, FSB Says". The Moscow Times. 13 February 2025. Retrieved 13 February 2025.-

Data.event_text: Two miners are killed in a collapse at a potash mine operated by Uralkali in Solikamsk, Perm Krai.

links.text: -"2 Workers Killed in Accident at Russian Potash Mine". The Moscow Times. 13 February 2025. Retrieved 13 February 2025.-

Data.event_text: Cryptocurrency exchange operator Alexander Vinnik, who had been imprisoned in the United States for a cybercrime conviction, is released and repatriated to Russia as part of a prisoner exchange.

links.text: -"Russian cybercriminal Alexander Vinnik returns to Moscow after prisoner swap". France 24. 14 February 2025. Retrieved 14 February 2025.-

Data.event_text: 17 February  Konstantin Rachalovsky, the deputy governor of Rostov Oblast, is arrested on suspicion of abuse of power over the provision of state subsidies amounting to 155.2 million rubles ($1.7 million) to financially distressed companies that eventually went bankrupt.

links.text: -"Rostov Region Deputy Governor Arrested for Abuse of Power". The Moscow Times. 17 February 2025. Retrieved 17 February 2025.-

Data.event_text: 18 February  Russia and the United States began official discussions in Saudi Arabia on ending the war in Ukraine.

links.text: -Sauer, Pjotr; Harding, Luke; Smith, David (18 February 2025). "US and Russia agree to explore mutual opportunities of end to Ukraine war". The Guardian. Retrieved 19 February 2025.-

Data.event_text: 26 February  Denis Alexeyev, the deputy governor of Vologda Oblast, is arrested along with Kirill Bocharov, head of the Vologda Oblast representative office in Moscow, on suspicion of receiving part of a 100 million ruble ($1.1 million) bribe.

links.text: -"Vologda Region Officials Arrested on Bribery Charges Amid Growing Pressure on Governor". The Moscow Times. 26 February 2025. Retrieved 26 February 2025.-

Data.event_text: 27 February  A man is arrested for throwing a grenade at the entrance to the regional administration office of Samara Oblast in Samara.

links.text: -"Man Arrested After Grenade Attack on Samara Region Government Building". The Moscow Times. 27 February 2025. Retrieved 27 February 2025.-

Data.event_text: 28 February  The FSB arrests two church officials on suspicion of plotting to kill Russian Orthodox bishop Tikhon Shevkunov, who is close to Putin.

links.text: -Lucy Papachristou. "Russia arrests two church figures over alleged Ukrainian plot to kill priest close to Putin". Reuters. Retrieved 28 February 2025.-

Data.event_text: 3 March  The FSB says it shot and killed a man who planned "terrorist attacks" on the Moscow metro and a Jewish religious institution in Moscow.

links.text: -"Russia's FSB says it shot dead a man planning 'terrorist attacks' in Moscow". Reuters. 3 March 2025. Retrieved 3 March 2025 – via Al Arabiya.-

Data.event_text: 4 March  Nikolai Onishchenko, the head of Zavyalovsky District, Altai Krai, is shot dead while leaving a cafe in Zavyalovo.

links.text: -"Altai Region Official Gunned Down in Broad Daylight". The Moscow Times. 4 March 2025. Retrieved 4 March 2025.-

Data.event_text: 5 March  Four suspected Islamic State militants are killed in an "anti-terrorist operation" in Makhachkala, Dagestan.

links.text: -"Russian Security Forces Kill 4 Suspected Islamic State Militants in Dagestan". The Moscow Times. 5 March 2025. Retrieved 5 March 2025.-

Data.event_text: 10 March  Two British diplomats are expelled from Russia for alleged spying.

links.text: -"Russia expels 2 British diplomats from embassy in Moscow over espionage claims". AP News. 10 March 2025. Retrieved 12 March 2025.-

Data.event_text: 11 March  Two students are injured in a knife attack at a school in Nizhny Novgorod. The suspect, who is also a student, is arrested.

links.text: -"Middle School Student Stabs Classmates in Nizhny Novgorod". The Moscow Times. 11 March 2025. Retrieved 12 March 2025.-

Data.event_text: 13 March  The Russian defence ministry says its forces had retaken Sudzha, Kursk Oblast from Ukraine.

links.text: -"Russian Army Liberates Sudzha in Kursk Border Region". The Moscow Times. 13 March 2025. Retrieved 13 March 2025.-

Data.event_text: The Ukrainian military launches a major incursion into Belgorod Oblast.

links.text: -"Zelensky confirms Ukraine troops in Russia's Belgorod region". BBC. Retrieved 8 April 2025.-

Data.event_text: Yury Bezdudny resigns as Governor of Nenets Autonomous Okrug.

links.text: -"Governor of Russia's Nenets Region Resigns". The Moscow Times. 18 March 2025. Retrieved 20 March 2025.-

Data.event_text: A Mil Mi-28 helicopter of the Russian military crashes in Leningrad Oblast, killing its entire crew.

links.text: -"Urgent: Mi-28 helicopter crashes in Russia's Leningrad region, killing crew: reports". Xinhua News Agency. 18 March 2025. Retrieved 19 March 2025.-

Data.event_text: 31 March  Konstantin Rudnev, the founder of the Ashram Shambala sect, is arrested along with 13 of his followers in Argentina on human trafficking charges.

links.text: -"Russian Cult Leader Nabbed in Argentine Human-Trafficking Swoop". The Moscow Times. Retrieved 3 April 2025.-

Data.event_text: 1 April  President Putin orders a ban on government, telecommunications and banking sector employees from using foreign messaging applications.

links.text: -"Putin Bans Government, Bank Employees From Using Foreign Messaging Apps". The Moscow Times. Retrieved 3 April 2025.-

Data.event_text: 2 April  A Tu-22M3 bomber crashes in Usolsky District, Irkutsk Oblast, killing one of its four crew.

links.text: -"Russian strategic bomber crashes in Siberia, one person dead, governor says". Reuters. 2 April 2025. Retrieved 2 April 2025.-

Data.event_text: 3 April  The State Duma expels Yury Napso as a deputy of the Liberal Democratic Party of Russia for failing to attend its sessions without valid reason since 2023.

links.text: -"Russian Lawmaker Stripped of Seat After 2-Year Absence". The Moscow Times. Retrieved 4 April 2025.-

Data.event_text: 4 April  Three Moldovan diplomats are expelled from Russia in retaliation for Moldova expelling three Russian diplomats it accused of involvement in facilitating the escape of fugitive MP Alexandr Nesterovschi.

links.text: -"Russia Expels Moldovan Diplomats in Tit-for-Tat Move". The Moscow Times. Retrieved 4 April 2025.-

Data.event_text: 8 April  Dual US-Russian national Ksenia Karelina, who had been imprisoned in Russia for donating to a charity providing humanitarian aid for Ukraine, is released and repatriated to the United States following a prisoner exchange in the United Arab Emirates that sees the release of Arthur Petrov, a dual German-Russian citizen arrested on suspicion of supplying manufacturers linked to the Russian military with microelectronics.

links.text: -"Woman jailed over £39 donation to Ukraine freed in US-Russia prisoner swap". BBC. Retrieved 10 April 2025.-

Data.event_text: 9 April  The Romanian defense attaché and his deputy are expelled from Russia in retaliation for Romania expelling their Russian counterparts in March.

links.text: -"Russia expels 2 Romanian diplomats in a tit-for-tat move". AP News. Retrieved 10 April 2025.-

Data.event_text: The Supreme Court of Russia removes the Taliban from Russia's list of designated terrorist organizations.

links.text: -"Russian Supreme Court Removes Taliban From List of Terrorist Organizations". The Moscow Times. Retrieved 17 April 2025.-

Data.event_text: Vadim Shamarin, the former deputy chief of the Russian General Staff, is convicted and sentenced to seven years' imprisonment by a court martial for accepting 36 million rubles ($437,600) in bribes from a phone manufacturing plant in exchange for state contracts and “general patronage.”.

links.text: -"Former Russian Army General Sentenced to 7 Years in Prison for Bribery". The Moscow Times. Retrieved 17 April 2025.-
